snippet: The private equity owners of US Foods, one of the country’s largest food distributors, set a $100 million preliminary target in their S.E.C. filing.
abstract: US Foods announces plans to go public less than year after failure of its plan to merge with rival Sysco; will be biggest company filing for an offering so far in 2016.

byline.original: By MICHAEL J. de la MERCED

lead_paragraph: The private equity owners of US Foods, one of the country’s largest food distributors, set a $100 million preliminary target in their S.E.C. filing.

headline.main: US Foods Plans to Go Public, Months After Failed Sysco Merger
headline.print_headline: US Foods Plans I.P.O., Revving Up a Slow Year
